metadata.feature_description: Manage different page types including normal, template, and special pages

steps.action: Navigate to Pages admin panel and click Add Page
steps.expected: Add Page form should appear with page type options
steps.actual: Add Page form appeared with Standard, Existing, URL, and File page type options

steps.action: Enter page name 'Test Normal Page Type' with Standard type selected
steps.expected: Form should accept the name with Standard page type
steps.actual: Name entered successfully with Standard type selected by default

steps.action: Click Add Page button to create the page
steps.expected: Page should be created and appear in the page list
steps.actual: Page 'Test Normal Page Type' was created successfully and appeared in the navigation

steps.action: Navigate to Pages admin and click Save Page Template dropdown
steps.actual: Save Page Template button with dropdown appeared showing 'Evoq Page Template' option

steps.action: Select 'Evoq Page Template' and enter template name 'Test Page Type Template'
steps.expected: Template creation form should accept the name
steps.actual: Form accepted the template name 'Test Page Type Template'

steps.expected: Template should be created and appear in the templates list
steps.actual: Template 'Test Page Type Template' was created successfully and appeared in the templates section with Edit/Delete options

steps.action: View page type options in Add Page form
steps.expected: Should see all available page types: Standard, Existing, URL, File
steps.actual: All four page types visible: Standard (selected by default), Existing, URL, File

steps.expected: Form should change to show URL-specific fields
steps.actual: Form changed to show URL input field, Permanent Redirect toggle, and Open Link In New Window toggle

steps.expected: Form should change to show Existing Page selection fields
steps.actual: Form changed to show 'Existing Page' dropdown with '<< None Specified > >' option, plus Permanent Redirect and Open Link In New Window toggles

steps.expected: Form should change to show File selection fields
steps.actual: Form changed to show file upload area with 'Drag and Drop a File or Select an Option', plus Permanent Redirect and Open Link In New Window toggles

steps.action: Select an existing page (Workflow Test Page) and view its settings
steps.expected: Page settings should show workflow configuration options
steps.actual: Page settings displayed with Workflow dropdown showing 'Content Approval' option, along with other page type specific fields

steps.action: Verify workflow dropdown options are available
steps.expected: Workflow dropdown should be accessible for Standard page type
steps.actual: Workflow dropdown is visible and shows current workflow selection. Header displays Versioning: Off and Workflow: Off status indicators

steps.action: Navigate to Advanced > More tab in page settings
steps.expected: Should see Security section with Disable Page option
steps.actual: Advanced > More tab displayed Security section with 'Secure Connection' and 'Disable Page' toggle options, plus Cache Settings

steps.expected: Disable Page toggle should be accessible and configurable
steps.actual: Disable Page toggle is visible and set to 'Off' by default. This option corresponds to the DisableLink property that marks a page as disabled

observations: The Page Type options (Standard, Existing, URL, File) correctly show different form fields based on the selected type
Standard pages show full form with name, title, description, keywords, tags, icons, workflow, and template options
URL type pages show a URL input field plus Permanent Redirect and Open Link In New Window toggles
Existing type pages show an Existing Page dropdown to select another page to redirect to
File type pages show a file upload/selection area for file-based redirects
The 'Disable Page' option is located in Advanced > More > Security section rather than as a separate page type
Workflow configuration is available for Standard page types through a dropdown on the Details tab
Template creation is accessible via the 'Save Page Template' dropdown button with 'Evoq Page Template' option
